definition: suddenly opens up to a wide panorama (idiom); to come to a wide clearing/fig. everything becomes clear at once/to achieve speedy enlightenment

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Looking up at the open sky, he suddenly cheered up.
sentences.chinese: 仰望碧天，他的心情豁然開朗。

sentences.english: Get this book, smarten up and most importantly face the reality.
sentences.chinese: 買書，閱讀後豁然開朗，最重要的是學會了面對現實。

sentences.english: Seems that your heart is filled up with silver moonlight, and then you are suddenly enlightened.
sentences.chinese: 你的心彷彿都灑滿了銀色的月光，豁然開朗起來。

sentences.english: Jurgis discovers socialism and gets all happy.
sentences.chinese: 吉蓋斯發現了社會主義，心情豁然開朗。

sentences.english: With the world economic globalization, the future of China is suddenly enlightened.
sentences.chinese: 全球化以颶風之勢激盪中國，炎黃的天空豁然開朗。

definition: a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
